description: Students explore geographic, economic, political, and ethnic dimensions of life in Costa Rica by combining intensive course work with such cross-cultural experiences as a homestay in San Jose, field work, visits to sites of cultural interest, and excursions to the Atlantic and Pacific coasts. They consolidate their language skills and continue to develop their skills for analyzing and communicating in Spanish through compositions, oral presentations, and interviews of Costa Ricans. Prerequisite: Spanish 231 or placement.
name: Inter Span II-C Rica
notes: Open to all students who meet the prerequisites.
You will find this course listed in Studio Abroad under its course title.
title: Intermediate Spanish II in Costa Rica
